title: Garmin City Navigator NTU 2015.40 Europe (UN)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Garmin City Navigator Europe 2015.40 NTU (Unicode) Full Unlocked + 3D + JVC + G2S


Navigate the streets of Europe with confidence. This product provides detailed 
road maps and points of interest for your compatible device, so you can navigate 
with exact, turn-by-turn directions to any address or intersection. Route to 
restaurants, gas stations, lodging, attractions and more.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Includes more than 10.8 million km (6.7 million mi) of roads, including 
motorways, national and regional thoroughfares and local roads, in Europe.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Displays more than 6.7 million points of interest throughout the country, 
including restaurants, lodging, border crossings, attractions, petrol stations, 
campsites, shopping and more.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Gives turn-by-turn directions on your compatible device.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Speaks street names (example: "Turn right on Main Street")
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Includes navigational features, such as turn restrictions, roundabout guidance, 
speed categories and more.
Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Contains traffic data for compatible devices that use traffic receivers

This realease include:

Garmin City Navigator Europe NTU (Unicode) 2015.40 Europe
G2S (D2925180A.G2S)
JCV(D3048180A.JCV High Resolution)
3D-Buildings

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                 Install Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you use on a' external SD-Card
Make a' folder named: Garmin (SD-Card/Garmin/)

Copy those files inside the Garmin folder:
gmapsupp.img
gmap3d.img
JCV

[JUNCTION VIEW
New Device with hidden .System Folder:
Device:.SystemJCV
Other Devices:
Device:GarminJCV
For all Devices with SD:
SD:GarminJCV]

[3D BUILDING ELEVATIONS
New Device with hidden .System Folder
Device:.Systemgmap3d.img file
SD:Mapgmap3d.img file
Other Devices
Device:Garmingmap3d.img file
SD:Garmingmap3d.img file

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

HINT EXTRA INFO >> HOW TO!!!

Install On Internal Memory in Garmin

1. Connect your Garmin to PC.
2. Go to the Nuvi files in your Garmin folder and backup 
the file Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to your PC.
3. Delete the Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file from Garmin.
4. Rename the new file you have downloaded "gmapsupp.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ to Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
5. Copy the unlocked Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapprom.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ file you renamed into the Garmin. 
6. Restart Garmin and check your map info: Tools>Settings>Map>Map Info.

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Install On Your SD Card

1. Get a 8GB SD card (NOT SDHC for old unit) and format it to FAT32
2. Create a folder on SD-card called Ã¢â‚¬Å“GarminÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
3. Copy the downloaded Ã¢â‚¬Å“gmapsupp.imgÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ + JVC + gmap3D.img into Garmin folder
Look like this SD-Card/Garmin
4. Insert your SD card into your Garmin GPS, and scroll to your map information on your Garmin GPS and you can see the new maps selected. This can be found on the device via : Tools>Settings>Map>Map Info.
5. Deselect the mapset that's are outdated.
